page.title: 01Ditcheat Hill & Environment
page.content: This is predominately a dairy farm area. Two farmhouse cheese making units operate. (50 years ago there were 10, on every farm)the number of farmers and formstaff is approx 30% of 1930, so many farmhouses on farms are now ocupied by people from other. Profesions and industries. Probably becaused the intercity railway station of castle cary (Paddington 11/2 hours) is only one mile south of this block and also because Ditcheat village (not ditcheat parish) was sewered about 1970, the number of houses in ditcheat village has increased by 60%. There are approx 1400 dairy cows, producing about 11/2 million gallons of milk annually, 1400 calves. (half british friesian for milk and beef and half here hereford, for all beef). The primary producers value of the milk and calves is at least Â£100M.
